issue.title: Adding directory to GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH causes shader lib not to be found

content.raw:
In my .bashrc file, I have the following lines:

    # so that Gazebo SDF files can do something like
    #<include>
    #  <uri>model://directory_with_model_sdf</uri>
    #</include>
    export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/media/jason/Lexar/model_editor_models:$GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH
    export GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH=/media/jason/Lexar/model_editor_models:$GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH

That's because I keep my Gazebo data on a removable drive so that the work is portable, but I haven't quite gotten the model import functionality working yet.

If I comment out the line with GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH and then re-execute .bashrc and retry the problematic commands in fresh terminal windows, the problem goes away! But I don't see why just adding a directory to the path would make the path search fail (unless I did it wrong, which is definitely possible).
